definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)

sentences.english: Following the sea is the tradition of his family.
sentences.chinese: 当海员是他家世代相传的职业。

sentences.english: Date palm trees in Iraq are passed down through generations as part of family legacies.
sentences.chinese: 在伊拉克，枣椰树是作为一种传家宝世代相传的。

sentences.english: Curly hair runs in the blood.
sentences.chinese: 卷发在这家是世代相传的。

sentences.english: Sunbird passes on from generation to generation beautiful fable.
sentences.chinese: 一个世代相传的美丽传说。

sentences.english: To ensure that the rice terraces of water-based civilization from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 保证了梯田稻作文明世代相传的水源基础。

sentences.english: "Ram the Spring and Autumn" as a family learning for generations to great-great-ram life.
sentences.chinese: 《公羊春秋》作为家学，世代相传至玄孙公羊寿。

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
from generation to generation/generation after generation
to pass on/to hand down/tradition has it that .../according to legend
handed down in a family/family traditions
passed on from ancestors/handed down from generation to generation
